程序包 it.unibo.functional

类 Transformers

java.lang.Object
it.unibo.functional.Transformers
public final class Transformers extends Object
A special utility class with methods that transform collections using Functions provided as parameters.

  • 方法概要

    修饰符和类型
    方法
    说明
    static <I> List<? extends I>
    flatten(Iterable<? extends Collection<? extends I>> base)
    A function that takes an iterable of collections, and returns a flatten list of the elements of the inner collections.

    A function that applies a transformation to each element of an Iterable, obtaining multiple elements, and then builds a "flat" list of these transformed elements.
    static <I> List<I>
    reject(Iterable<I> base, Function<I,Boolean> test)
    A function that applies a test to each element of an Iterable, returning a list containing only the elements that do not pass the test.

    A function that applies a test to each element of an Iterable, returning a list containing only the elements that pass the test.

  • 方法详细资料

    • flattenTransform

      public static <I, O> List<O> flattenTransform(Iterable<? extends I> base, Function<I,? extends Collection<? extends O>> transformer)
      A function that applies a transformation to each element of an Iterable, obtaining multiple elements, and then builds a "flat" list of these transformed elements. For instance, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] could use flattenTransform to transform only the odd numbers into squares, passing a function that returns an empty List for even numbers and a List with the square of the input otherwise, obtaining as output [1, 9, 25].
      类型参数:
      I - input elements type
      O - output elements type
      参数:
      base - the elements on which to operate
      transformer - the Function to apply to each element. It must transform the elements into a (possibly empty) collection of other elements.
      返回:
      A "flattened" list of the produced elements

    • transform

      public static <I, O> List<O> transform(Iterable<I> base, Function<I,O> transformer)
      A function that applies a transformation to each element of an Iterable, returning a list of these transformed elements. For instance, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] could use transform to produce a list of squares by passing a function that computes the square of the input, thus obtaining [1, 4, 9, 16, 25]. NOTE: this function is a special flattenTransform whose function always return a list with a single element
      类型参数:
      I - input elements type
      O - output elements type
      参数:
      base - the elements on which to operate
      transformer - the Function to apply to each element.
      返回:
      A transformed list where each input element is replaced with the produced elements

    • flatten

      public static <I> List<? extends I> flatten(Iterable<? extends Collection<? extends I>> base)
      A function that takes an iterable of collections, and returns a flatten list of the elements of the inner collections. For instance, [[1], [2, 3], [4, 5], []] could use flatten to produce a flat list, thus obtaining [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]. NOTE: this function is a special flattenTransform whose input is an iterable of collections, and whose function simply returns each collection (identity).
      类型参数:
      I - type of the collection elements
      参数:
      base - the collections on which to operate
      返回:
      A flattened list with the elements of each collection in the input

    • select

      public static <I> List<I> select(Iterable<I> base, Function<I,Boolean> test)
      A function that applies a test to each element of an Iterable, returning a list containing only the elements that pass the test. For instance, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] could use select to filter only the odd numbers, thus obtaining [1, 3, 5]. NOTE: this function is a special flattenTransform whose function returns a list with a single element if the element passes the test, and an empty list otherwise.
      类型参数:
      I - elements type
      参数:
      base - the elements on which to operate
      test - the Function to use to test whether the elements should be selected.
      返回:
      A list containing only the elements that passed the test

    • reject

      public static <I> List<I> reject(Iterable<I> base, Function<I,Boolean> test)
      A function that applies a test to each element of an Iterable, returning a list containing only the elements that do not pass the test. For instance, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] could use select to reject all the even numbers, thus obtaining [1, 3, 5]. NOTE: this function is a special select whose test function return value is negated.
      类型参数:
      I - elements type
      参数:
      base - the elements on which to operate
      test - the Function to use to test whether the elements should be discarded.
      返回:
      A list containing only the elements that passed the test
